newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi prince, partner, buy Boston's Copley hotel.
newsitem.headline: Saudi prince, partner, buy Boston's Copley hotel.

text.p: The Saudi Arabian prince who owns stakes in Saks Fifth Avenue and the Plaza Hotel in New York has added Boston's Copley Plaza Hotel to his holdings, the prince's office said Wednesday.
Prince al-Waleed bin Talal bin Abdulaziz bought the 379-room Copley Plaza in partnership with Olympus Real Estate Corp., a Dallas-based real estate development and investment company.

"In a transaction completed today, a partnership between entities controlled by ... Prince al-Waleed ... and Olympus Real Estate Corp. of Dallas has acquired the Copley Plaza Hotel in Boston," the statement said.
It said the hotel will be managed by the San Francisco-based Fairmont Hotel chain, which is 50-percent owned by the prince.
"A renovation programme, which we plan to commence immediately, will ... enhance the value of the property," David Deniger, president of Olympus Real Estate, said in the statement.
The prince also has ownership stakes in Citicorp, Euro Disney, Canary Wharf in London's Docklands and the Four Seasons hotel chain.
